meanings.definition: To make emotional or to become emotional.
meanings.sent1: She was emotionalizing the situation by crying.
meanings.sent2: He tends to emotionalize every decision he makes.
meanings.sent3: The movie's attempt to emotionalize the audience fell flat.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a way of emotionalizing even the toughest hearts.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting beautifully emotionalized the viewers.

meanings.definition: The act of expressing or evoking emotions.
meanings.sent1: Her emotionalizing of her feelings was evident in her artwork.
meanings.sent2: The emotionalizing in his music resonated with the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's emotionalizing of everyday situations made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sunset's colors had a natural emotionalizing effect on the onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The book's emotionalizing of the characters made them unforgettable.
